div.p: This implementation guide defines the use of FHIR R4 resources to exchange information that indicates where patients, staff, devices, or other assets are located within a hospital or other healthcare facility.

A Real Time Location System (RTLS) captures, process, and stores information about the location of tracking tags. These tags are associated to an assigned subject (patients, providers, devices) and their location data is typically exchanged between a RTLS system and other healthcare systems as they move around a healthcare facility. This data can be used for many applications such as workflow automation, staff/asset tracking, and patient monitoring.

The scope of this implementation guide includes support for workflows related to communication between a RTLS and another healthcare system, such as Electronic Health Record (EHR) software. This includes the following:

ul.li: Tag assignment and unassignment for patients, staff, or devices
Addition and removal of tags from circulation

div.p: This specification addresses tracking only of patients, providers, and devices. Other subjects/resources in the healthcare setting such as supplies and pharmaceuticals may be tracked by some systems.
